file_content.text: Good fight. You've got... well. You've got something I don't have anymore.
I am Sith. Next to me, you are nothing.
I have the power of the Force.
Did you think you could take Balmorra? Did you think you could defeat me? I am a master of the dark side.
I want to see you weep.
You are what you are. Listen, please.
Our people are united in our commitment to an ordered galaxy. You're still clinging to dreams of independence.
The Empire knows victory.
I've got instincts you'll never have.
I'm just better at my job.
Maybe so. Hear me out.
It's not too late to stop more killing.
Now will you negotiate?
I'm glad to hear you say that.
One shot, and you're a corpse on the floor.
I'm sick of talking, scum.
One stroke of my lightsaber and you're a corpse on the floor.
I'm sick of talking, scum.
I'm aware. Please wait.
I know how much the Empire wants to expose the Republic's... involvement in Balmorra. Publicly.
I can confess the truth of the invasion--if you help my men.
Talk. And make it good.
You have my attention.
Dead Jedi, Republic transports... even before I came to the factory, I met squads of Republic troops. Why do I need your confession?
The truth is all around us!
Because you know the truth, but the rest of the galaxy doesn't--and they'll trust my word over yours.
What happened to the grand marshal who showed defiance?
You've changed your tune.
It's just us now--none of my boys left to inspire.
Let the Balmorrans and the non-combatants leave. Treat the Republic soldiers fairly, as prisoners of war.
Help them, and I'll tell everyone we violated the treaty.
Okay. I'll show mercy.
The Empire isn't without mercy. We can come to an agreement.
Agreed. You're more useful alive.
I... appreciate that.
Sounds like your troops made it inside. Keep your word, I'll keep mine.
Time to go, Cheketta.
We're finished here.
When you broadcast your confession, tell the Republic to disarm and withdraw from Imperial space. Nothing like Balmorra can happen again.
I want you to push for peace.
You're only delaying the inevitable--but I'll say it.
Your troops can live, Cheketta--but someone has to pay. Once you've confessed, you will be executed.
One condition: You must die.
Huh. I can't say I'm surprised. But I've made worse deals.
You're in no position to strike a deal.
I don't need your confession.
Damn it--that's everything you could want! Why?
You and your men--every resistance fighter on this planet--must be punished.
The Empire shows no mercy.
I can have one confession, or a thousand resistance fighters and weapons engineers.
You're all valuable captives.
They'll give me everything I want, and a great deal more.
This won't last forever. Your Empire won't last, I swear.
You won't have to wonder very long.
Why not? [Kill him]
Sir! Squad 815. Darth Lachris sent us to reinforce your position.
The grand marshal is dead. We're done here.
Take the grand marshal into custody. We're done for now.
Understood.
There's fighting all over the factory, but it looks like a victory. Orders are to regroup at the outpost when you can--sir!
The fleet may be lost, but my Padawan and I can hold the Imperials while you regroup.
No. You've got your ship, we've got a few of our own--I want you to get the non-combatants and the wounded off Balmorra....
...after we handle this. You're damn tough, you know that?
How many years have you survived under siege? You've had a good run.
You're pretty tough yourself.
It's not over yet.
If we'd tried talking from the beginning, we might not be in this mess.
You shouldn't have attacked.
Anything's possible, I suppose.
I've got Jedi at my back and the finest armor Balmorran Arms ever designed. Ignore the scratches.
We can cover your escape.
Nah. Let's see what an old man can do for his troops.
Jedi and a grand marshal, dead at my hand.
Shut up and die. [Attack]
Weapons out!
Everyone, on your guard!
